ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Allah is your Lord and Lord of your forefathers, the previous peoples,'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: God, your Lord, and the Lord of your fathers?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your ancestors of yore.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Allah – Who is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of yore?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: God, your Lord, and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: God your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers?,’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Allah, your Lord and Cherisher and the Lord and Cherisher of your fathers of old?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your fathers, the ancients'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: God is your Lord, and the Lord of your ancestors.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:126] God, your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers?’ (read [as predicates] allāhu, rabbukum and rabbu, in the nominative, because of the [implicit] omitted huwa [being the subject]; or read allāha, rabbakum and rabba, in the accusative, as supplements to ahsana, ‘the best of’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Allah, your Lord) your Creator (and Lord of your forefathers) and the Creator of your forefathers before you?
